newsitem.title: HONDURAS: North and Central America port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: North and Central America port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

HONDURAS, May 19 - Puerto Cortes - Vessels berthed - 4 discharging/loading containers, 1 discharging fertiliser, 1 discharging fuel. Vessels awaiting berth, 4 discharging/loading containers, 1 discharging wheat, 1 discharging fuel, 2 discharging asphalt. Vessels due, 5 to discharge bananas, 6 to load/discharge containers, 1 to discharge rice, 1 to load sugar, 1 to discharge fertiliser.
MEXICO, May 20 - Tampico - vessels in port - 1 corn, 1 general cargo, 1 pipes, 2 mineral, 1 cement.
Altamira - vessels in port - 1 repairs, 1 chemicals.
Veracruz - vessels in port - 3 containers, 3 sugar, 1 steel coils, 3 corn, 2 grain.
Manzanillo - vessels in port - 3 containers, 2 general cargo, 1 urea, 2 grain.
Coatzacoalcos - vessels in port - 7 chemicals, 10 oil tankers, 1 repairs. All ports working normally.
PANAMA, May 19 - Cristobal - four vessels due to work cargo.
Balboa - six vessels due today to work cargo.

Panama Canal - waterway working at full capacity. Delays of 2-3 days for vessels over 91 ft. beam and 1-2 days for vessels under 91 ft. beam. The following locks lanes outages are confirmed - 7/7 to 19/7 and 11/8 to 21/8 - simultaneous Miraflores and Gatun with projected daily transits of 28-30 vessels. During these periods, delays could reach 5 or 6 days, depending on ship arrivals. Single lane outage Miraflores from 11/8 to 21/8 and 28-29/8. Projected daily transits of 32 to 34 vessels. Thirty-four vessels due, 61 in queue, 13 booked, 37 scheduled. Conditions 18/5 - actual arrivals 43, transits 42. Average of booked and non-booked canal waters time 46.5 hours.
